Subjective: Trouble passing hard stools for ~3 months; skips bowel movements for 2-3 days. Associated abdominal cramps, bloating, and swollen abdomen. Painful when abdomen is pressed. Long-standing poor appetite and underweight status. Tried olive oil with some success. No blood in stool, no recent weight loss, no changes in diet/urination. Family Hx: Sister with ulcerative colitis. Request: Wants to know if this is serious and how to soften stools. Interested in future dietician referral.
Objective: Abdomen: Appears bloated/rounder. Auscultation: Normal bowel sounds. Percussion: Varying tympani, dampening in LLQ. Palpation: Tenderness in LLQ. No tenderness in RUQ, LUQ, RLQ, or renal lodges.
Assessment: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), constipation-predominant. No alarm symptoms noted.
Plan: Take one sachet daily with plenty of water for the next 6 weeks.
Safety Netting: Return sooner if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or significant blood appears in stool.
Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate results.
Will discuss dietician referral at next appointment.
